required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of IV Acetaminophen Versus Oral Acetaminophen
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-Blind Clinical Study Evaluating Efficacy of Intravenous Versus Enteric Acetaminophen in Donor Nephrectomy and Robot-Assisted, Laparoscopic Nephrectomy.

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine whether intravenous acetaminophen compared to enteric acetaminophen offers increased efficacy in patients who are scheduled for laparoscopic donor nephrectomy and for patients scheduled for robot-assisted, laparoscopic nephrectomy for renal cancer at the University of Rochester Medical Center. The standard surgical and post-operative care, including post-operative pain management will not be altered.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Average surgical pain intensity on a 0-10 numeric rating scale (NRS) administered .
primary_outcome.description: Pain intensity will be measured using a numeric rating scale of 0 to 10, with 10 being worse pain.

secondary_outcome.description: The inspiratory capacity will be presented as a percentage of the subject's baseline (pre-operative) inspiratory capacity.Inspiratory capacity is measured using a Voldyne 5000 incentive spirometer (Hudson RCI, Teleflex Medical). Inspiratory capacity will be recorded pre-operatively and at the time of pain assessments (1-2 hours and 20-24 hours post-operatively). Inspiratory capacity will recorded in milliliters to the nearest 250 cc mark on the incentive spirometer. Proper use of the incentive spirometer will be demonstrated to the patient in the pre-anesthesia holding area by a study investigator

The inspiratory capacity will be presented as a percentage of the subject's baseline (pre-operative) inspiratory capacity.Inspiratory capacity is measured using a Voldyne 5000 incentive spirometer (Hudson RCI, Teleflex Medical). Inspiratory capacity will be recorded pre-operatively and at the time of pain assessments (1-2 hours and 20-24 hours post-operatively). Inspiratory capacity will recorded in milliliters to the nearest 250 cc mark on the incentive spirometer. Proper use of the incentive spirometer will be demonstrated to the patient in the pre-anesthesia holding area by a study investigator

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean total opioid dose used in 24 hours
Mean dynamic pain score during incentive spirometer use
secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity will be measured using a numeric rating scale of 0 to 10, with 10 being worse pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean dynamic pain score during incentive spirometer use
secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity will be measured using a numeric rating scale of 0 to 10, with 10 being worse pain.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean time to first narcotic use
Mean time to discharge from post-anesthesia care unit
Average surgical pain intensity on a 0-10 numeric rating scale (NRS)
secondary_outcome.description: Pain intensity will be measured using a numeric rating scale of 0 to 10, with 10 being worse pain.

intervention.description: Active Intravenous doses will consist of a single 1,000mg/100 ml IV dose with contents of commercial vials transferred to an empty sterile IV bag.
500mg acetaminophen tablet ,2 capsules oral every six hours for 24 hours
Placebo Intravenous doses will consist of 100ml of normal saline transferred to an empty sterile IV bag.
Placebo, opaque capsules that have been filled with inert powder (lactose USP), 2 capsules oral every six hours for 24 hours

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Be at least 18 years old
- Be scheduled for donor nephrectomy or robot-assisted, laparoscopic nephrectomy for cancer at University of Rochester Medical Center
- Have cognitive ability to verbally rate their pain on the Numeric Rating Scale (NRS).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age younger than 18 years old or older than 90 years old
- Pregnancy (Pre-operative pregnancy test is standard of care for all elective operating room cases)
- Weight less than 50 kg
- Anticipated surgical case duration greater than 5 hours
- Epidural use
- History of known liver disease.
- Patient unable to take enteral medications.
- Be taking opioid medications chronically.
